channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: A pediatrician working in Gaza on how she finds the will to keep going
item.description: Dr. Seema Jilani is a pediatrician who has been providing medical care to children in Gaza.

item.title: In wake of defunding, the Corporation for Public Broadcasting says it's shutting down
item.description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting said today it will start winding down its operations after it lost federal funding.

item.title: Remembering accordion master Flaco Jimenez
item.description: Over a career that spanned 70 years, Jimenez' playing came to define Tex-Mex music and carried the tradition-drenched conjunto sound all over the world and across genres.

item.title: States sue Trump administration over its actions against gender-affirming health care
item.description: Today 16 states and the District of Columbia filed a lawsuit in support of children's hospitals and doctors that have provided gender-affirming care for minors, contending the Trump administration has acted illegally in pressuring doctors and children's hospitals to stop.

item.title: After a disappointing jobs report, President Trump lashes out
item.description: President Trump announced new tariffs Thursday, and a jobs report out Friday fell short of expectations. We look at the political and economic fallout.

item.title: Researchers find some bird parents get 'divorced' after breeding
item.description: A new study from Oxford University finds that a common European songbird sometimes divorces its partner between breeding seasons.

item.title: The wildfire that destroyed the Grand Canyon Lodge a month ago is still growing
item.description: Firefighters are having a lot of trouble controlling the fire that destroyed the historic Grand Canyon Lodge. Rapid growth now threatens a remote and fragile forest ecosystem.

item.title: The ad campaign that launched a thousand critiques: Sydney Sweeney's jeans
item.description: One topic dominated online conversation this week: the American Eagle jeans ad featuring actress Sydney Sweeney. We break down why people are so worked up about it.

item.title: A Michigan mayor near the Canadian border on what tariffs mean for his city
item.description: A Michigan mayor talks with NPR's All Things Considered about how tariffs will affect constituents.

item.title: 'Architecton' is an epically cinematic look at the building blocks of civilization
item.description: A nearly wordless meditation on the building blocks of civilization — stone and concrete — Viktor Kossakovsky's documentary Architecton is a dazzling sensory overload.
